intro: Amauropelta pleiophylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed star moss, is a rare and unique fern-like plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Pterobryaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fronds that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, moss-like structures. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to soil stability and nutrient cycling. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and adaptation. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
